document.masterDocTitle: A taxonomic monograph of the Middle American leaf-litter inhabiting weevil genus Theognete Champion (Coleoptera: Curculionidae; Molytinae; Lymantini) 2458

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: A taxonomic monograph of the Middle American leaf-litter inhabiting weevil genus Theognete Champion (Coleoptera: Curculionidae; Molytinae; Lymantini) 2458

subSubSection.paragraph:
77.
Theognete weiri Anderson
, new species
( Figures 14 , 23 , 249 , 266 , 283 )

Diagnosis. Size. Length, male, 2.30–3.68mm ; female, 3.32–4.10mm . Width, male, 1.85–2.14mm ; female, 1.69–2.14mm . As for
T. baranowskii
but body more elongate, pronotum with shallow, broad, paramedian impression on disk; elytra mostly with scattered, low, elongate tubercles along length of intervals; all striae distinctly punctate and variously impressed, some strial punctures very large and deep; posterolateral area with punctures contiguous with those of elytral stria. Aedeagus as in Fig. 266 .

Comments. In original sorting of the species, I distinguished three forms within this species, based on slight differences in male and female genitalia and other structural features, but these did not correlate with each other or with locality, elevation or any other variable. However, further study may prove this to be a complex of very similar species.
Natural history . Collected from berlese extraction of cloud forest, oak forest, mixed pine forest and boreal forest leaf litter at elevations ranging from 1600–2925m .

Derivation of specific name . Through his support of the Nature Discovery Fund at the Canadian Museum of Nature, this species is named after Peter Weir of North York, Ontario , Canada , as a gift from Adam Quinan (and The Gunroom of HMSSurprise.org).

Material examined .
107♂ , 72♀♀ ( BMNH , CMNC , CNCI , CWOB , ECOS , FMNH , MCZC , MZLU , USNM )
.
